newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Normandy says Reynolds to work on strategy.
newsitem.headline: Normandy says Reynolds to work on strategy.

text.p: Australia's biggest gold miner, Normandy Mining Ltd, said on Thursday it had hired newspaper executive John Reynolds as group executive, strategy and structure, based on his management and human resources skills.
A spokesman told Reuters that Reynolds would report directly to executive chairman Robert de Crespigny and work closely with managing director Tony Palmer as the company expanded.
Sydney-based publisher John Fairfax Holdings Ltd said earlier that Reynolds would leave the company on August 8.
He was managing director of the Fairfax unit David Syme and Co, the publisher of The Age newspaper in Melbourne.
Reynolds was formerly with Australian Provincial Newspapers Ltd and was considered to be a candidate to lead Fairfax before it hired chief executive Bob Muscat last year.
